title:
Revisiting Tilt and Tensor-to-Scalar Ratio in the Multi-Scalar Field
  Inflation
authors:
Fereshteh Felegary, Seyed Ali Hosseini Mansoori, Tahere Fallahi
  Serish, Phongpichit Channuie
abstract:
The present work investigates the possible range of the spectral index $n_s$
and the tensor-to-scalar ratio $r$ for a sub-class of the generalized
multi-scalar field inflation, which includes a linear coupling term between the
multi-scalar field potential and the canonical Lagrangian. This coupling
influences the slow-roll parameters and also alters our predictions for $n_{s}$
and $r$, which directly depend on those parameters. More precisely, compared to
standard multi-field inflation, the values of $n_{s}$ and $r$ decrease to
levels consistent with the recent Planck+BICEP/Keck constraint. Interestingly,
this validates the chaotic-type potential $V=\sum_{i} \mu_{i} \phi_{i}^{p}$,
which were previously ruled out in the light of the current observations.
